page.title: 06EAST WITTERING C.P.SCHOOL
page.content: East Wittering Primary School was originally housed in the Parish Hall which was old and always seemed dusty. There were then three classes which were all held in the main hall.Each teacher had a blackboard and easel and the pupils had slates and chalks for some lessons and books for others. The"new"school was built in 1949 and today consists of four classrooms in the mainbuilding,a classroom used as a library,a dining area,two hutted class rooms and a purpose built Nursery Unit which is used as an additional infant classroom.In Sept.'85 there will be 3 Infant classes and 4 Junior classes.We use the Youth Centre nearby two after_ noons per week for P.E.,Country Dancing and Movement,and the playground and school field for Games when the weather is fine.
